oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1959-11-07 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from November 7, 1959. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), George Morgan (host/performer), guest performer Margie Bowes, and regular performers the Jordanaires, Tommy Jackson, Chet Atkins, Archie Campbell, and Del Wood. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 1048th broadcast.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: George Morgan; Jordanaires; Margie Bowes; Tommy Jackson; Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces George Morgan -- I Couldn't Believe It Was True (George Morgan) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, George Morgan) -- George Morgan introduces the Jordanaires -- I Ain't Never (Jordanaires) -- George Morgan and Grant Turner introduce Margie Bowes -- I Love You So Much I Let You Go (Margie Bowes) -- Prince Albert commercial (Grant Turner, George Morgan) -- Grant Turner introduces Tommy Jackson -- Liberty (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Grant Turner and George Morgan talk -- In The Garden (George Morgan, Jordanaires) -- Grant Turner introduces Chet Atkins -- Yes Sir, That's My Baby (Chet Atkins)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); United States. Armed Forces Radio Service; Turner, Grant; Sloan, Ralph; Tennessee Travelers; Campbell, Archie; Atkins, Chet; Wood, Del; Jackson, Tommy; Jordanaires (Musical group); Wiggins, Roy; Morgan, George, 1925-1975; Bowes, Margie; Robbins, Marty
